channel.title: New GFX card and monitors (Small upgrade)
channel.description:
I'm looking to upgrade my PC, 2x22" monitors (Or bigger) and a new gfx card.
Current specs:
[ul][li]Q6600[/li] [li]Asus mobo[/li] [li]Samsung 1tb hard drive[/li] [li]BFG 9600 GT[/li] [li]4gb ram[/li] [li]Load of other shit[/li][/ul]
So, I'm looking to get another graphics card, and 2x22" monitors. The graphics card has to be good enough to support decent games on these monitors. I have (Well, more prefer) to buy from eBuyer, don't really want anything with less than 5 customer reviews less than 5 stars.
Monitors: http://www.ebuyer.com/product/158382 (love and hate the fact it looks like a TV)
I have no idea about the graphics card. I would prefer something that will run both of the monitors (DVI), without a loud fan, and quite cheap. I'll be using my current graphics card (for now) to power my other two monitors until I figure out how useless 4 monitors is.
Please post your thoughts.
edit inb4 fags: I will be upgrading the processor, motherboard, RAM and other shit after I get more money. I can't afford (at the moment) i7s and shit.

item.title: New GFX card and monitors (Small upgrade)
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Stork, post:18, topic:327740”]I also prefer shittier products for the sake of misguided brand loyalty.[/quote]Fanboys </3

item.title: New GFX card and monitors (Small upgrade)
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

An ATI 4870 or 4890 will give you more bang for your buck than any nVidia card I’m aware of.

Read full topic
item.source: New GFX card and monitors (Small upgrade)

item.title: New GFX card and monitors (Small upgrade)
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“chri5, post:15, topic:327740”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=424124.msg3116007#msg3116007 date=1264973297]

[quote author=chri5 link=topic=424124.msg3115825#msg3115825 date=1264958210]

[quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=424124.msg3115813#msg3115813 date=1264957606]

GTS250 wont be much of an improvment at all?[/quote]

I mean depending on his price range getting a gts 250 is just silly, gtx275’s aren’t that much more.

Also to op: consider getting something like a H50 and ocing the q6600. I’m still running my q6600 at stock but with 90c tjmax my comp idles at 15c avg each core, and won’t go over 40c with prime95(room temp being pretty cold).

True, but I can’t find any in stock. Newegg has one but its 370 dollars. You could get two GTS 250s for the price of that and put them in SLI. Tigerdirect has one for 250 http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=4559658&CatId=3775 but getting two GTS250’s in SLI is about the same price but I’m not sure what would perform better.[/quote]
Shame I don’t live in the US…

I would really get the ATI 5770 because of DirectX 11 support but seeing that you are using linux I don’t know how that would work out.

Yeah… I’d prefer to use Nvidia anyway. Companies that don’t provide Linux divers should be avoided.
[/quote]sry but ati has been providing linux drivers for years

Ooops, my mistake. Anyway, I prefer Nvidia.[/quote]

I used to prefer nvidia over ati but now with directx 11 support and video cards with dual dvi, one hdmi, and one display port out I would choose ati easily.

Read full topic

item.source: New GFX card and monitors (Small upgrade)

item.title: New GFX card and monitors (Small upgrade)
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

I dont see a £80 GTS 250 on ebuyer, unless your mistaking that fucking POS that cows_be_scared posted.

There is an Asus one on the there just under £100 that I meant. http://www.ebuyer.com/product/173803

mwiebelhaus:

I have experience with this card, http://www.ebuyer.com/product/181287 I used it for two weeks in a computer that I built for my grandparents and it was good. It plays GTA IV well and both the Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfares.

Just watched a video review on Youtube and read some reviews, that looks seriously sick. But it’s not that new? I really want a card that won’t outdate too much in 6 months.

mwiebelhaus:

It would help more though if you posted the games you would be playing with it.

Well, I will be playing (mostly) older games like Half Life 2, Garry’s Mod, CS:S, that sort of thing. But I do like Call of Duty: MW2, and I would like to play new games too on a HD monitor.

mwiebelhaus:

Anyways I would go with the 5770 if you don’t plan on using linux. It has a built in HDMI connector which you can do sound over. So if you want to hook this up to a HDTV you could use it as a media center pc easily.

I will be using Linux, but when I notice a game doesn’t run I’ll have a stripped XP/7 to play on.

Read full topic
item.source: New GFX card and monitors (Small upgrade)

item.title: New GFX card and monitors (Small upgrade)
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I dont see a £80 GTS 250 on ebuyer, unless your mistaking that fucking POS that cows_be_scared posted. I have experience with this card, http://www.ebuyer.com/product/181287 I used it for two weeks in a computer that I built for my grandparents and it was good. It plays GTA IV well and both the Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfares. In American that GTS250 I posted costs £75 instead of the £108 you will be paying. It would help more though if you posted the games you would be playing with it.

[quote=“Niall, post:6, topic:327740”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=424124.msg3114855#msg3114855 date=1264879111]
Well the 250 is much better then the 9800.
[/quote]

It’s a repackaged 9800gtx+ with the option of 1gb ram…

To op: you could get a gtx 275 or something, a 9800gtx+/gts 250 won’t much of an improvement at all.[/quote]

GTS250 wont be much of an improvment at all?

Anyways I would go with the 5770 if you don’t plan on using linux. It has a built in HDMI connector which you can do sound over. So if you want to hook this up to a HDTV you could use it as a media center pc easily.

Read full topic

item.title: New GFX card and monitors (Small upgrade)
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“chri5, post:3, topic:327740”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=424124.msg3114838#msg3114838 date=1264878077]
If you’ve got a 6pin connector + 500w psu get a 9800GT
[/quote]
Inno3D looks like another cheap chinaware manufacture.

And as for monitors http://www.ebuyer.com/product/175221 those are really, really nice.

Do you have experience with it? Plus the bracket looks horrible, my desk will/should look good after the upgrade :P.

Thanks :).

EDIT
I heard Ollie has a GTS 250. It must be good if he has it. Right?
http://www.ebuyer.com/product/173803 Looks in my price range too.[/quote]
Well the 250 is much better then the 9800.
But those monitors are extremely nice, I recently ordered one and it should come tomorrow.
Those are the monitors at my school and they are extremely nice.

Read full topic

@chri5 wrote:

I’m looking to upgrade my PC, 2x22" monitors (Or bigger) and a new gfx card.

[ul][li]Q6600[/li]

http://www.ebuyer.com/product/158382 (love and hate the fact it looks like a TV)
